column4: Puppe, D., Höhn, A., Kaczorek, D., Wanner, M., Wehrhan, M., & Sommer, M. (2017). How big is the influence of biogenic silicon pools on short-term changes in water-soluble silicon in soils? Implications from a study of a 10-year-old soil–plant system. Biogeosciences, 14(22), 5239-5252.
column13: One reference to generic ref or multiple references
column18: Data in the text of the article
column21: Table in the text of the article
column26:
This article aims at studying  the different BSi pools influence short-term
changes in the water-soluble Si fraction in soils, so I think it is a geochemical type of study but it can be also be plant physiology (as the phytolith abundance and volume are parts of the study)./ The article is difficult to assess because it is not really about phytolith identification but more about plant and soil interaction. The procedure follows  Biermans and Baert 1977, modified by Kodama and Ross 1991, Kendrick and Graham 2004, Kodama and Ross, 1991; Alexandre et al. 1997, Sauer et al. 2006./ Well-described couting method Puppe et al., 2014, 2015, 2016.
